issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I tried to create a load balancer on the non-VPC QA console #1 (see attachments).

I selected "Enable logging" and then the "Create Load Balancer" button.

One of the warnings I got told me after the load balancer is created to update my security group rules (see attachment). But I never had the opportunity to select a security group.

If a default security group is assigned for non-VPC clouds, maybe tell the user, make the default work, and avoid the warning.

attachment.filename: Health Check and Advanced tab1 - Create Load Balancer.png
Health Check and Advanced tab2 - Create Load Balancer.png

fields.summary: Create Load Balancer tells me to update security group rules but I did not select a security group

comments.body: The security group rules warning shouldn't display on a non-VPC cloud.

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/blob/master/eucaconsole/static/js/pages/elb_wizard.js#L712
The actual value is "None", so this check is likely not doing what was intended.
Not many (if any) customers are on VPC yet, everybody is still in EDGE mode pretty much, which means ALL our customers will see this bug if we don't get it in 4.2.

[~alice], [~ccassler]: To verify this fix, the security group rules warning should not display at all on non-VPC clouds when the Create Load Balancer button is clicked (on the wizard), or when the Submit Changes button is clicked on the ELB detail page (General tab).  

As a sanity check, the rules warning dialog should display on VPC clouds when the security group rules don't adequately cover the listener/healthcheck ports.

[~kgill] I tested on setup #1 and I see a warning come up very briefly and then go away. I could not read the warming because it disappears so quickly, but I managed to take a screenshot which I attached. From the screenshot I could see that it is the same warning that [~lnajjar] reported.

Package information:

{code}
[root@b-34 eucaconsole]# rpm -qi eucaconsole
Name        : eucaconsole                  Relocations: (not relocatable)
Version     : 4.2.0                             Vendor: Eucalyptus Systems, Inc.
Release     : 0.0.7534.614.20151013gitc1bb190.el6   Build Date: Tue 13 Oct 2015 02:33:56 PM PDT
Install Date: Tue 13 Oct 2015 02:37:55 PM PDT      Build Host: euca-10-111-54-188
Group       : Unspecified                   Source RPM: eucaconsole-4.2.0-0.0.7534.614.20151013gitc1bb190.el6.src.rpm
Size        : 17880082                         License: BSD and MIT and OFL
Signature   : (none)
URL         : http://github.com/eucalyptus/koala
Summary     : Eucalyptus Management Console
Description :
This package contains the web UI for the Eucalyptus cloud platform.
It also works with Amazon Web Services.

{code}
[~kgill], I'm pretty sure there is a cron job that runs at noon and midnight to update console packages. I'll manually do it now on both shared setups.
[~tony]: Thanks.  Yeah, https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1641 was merged after noon, so that probably explains it!
Perfect, thanks [~tony]!  Back on your plate [~alice].
[~tony], [~kgill] FYI I used a console installed by me that was pointing on setup #1. I included the package information and I verified with help from [~gholms] that the fix was in those packages.
Verified ELB creation works as expected on EC2 classic euca cloud with FF and Chrome.
